questions.question: .................................. them have returned.
questions.description: Before a pronoun, we use many of.

questions.question: I don't have ................................. time.
questions.description: We use much before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: I couldn't answer .................................... the questions.
questions.description: We use any of before a noun with an article or another determiner.

questions.question: He wasn't there for .................................... the time we spent in his house.
questions.description: We use much of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: This is more .................................... enough.
questions.description: We use than after a comparative expression.

questions.question: .................................... these papers with you when you go to college.
.......................................... one of these do you want?
questions.description: We cannot use what with one.

questions.question: It is ...................................... expensive dress I have ever bought.
I haven't seen her ..................................... May.
questions.description: Since is used with the starting point.
